title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: There is only one interview. Once you're able to swim and are lifeguard certified it is basically an automatic hire. If you're not certified they will give the option to get certified there.
Interview Questions: What made you apply for this job?

title: Front Desk Receptionist/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Sent in application; was interviewed in person; received an offer. The interview was laid back. This was a student job. I told them about myself and they told me about the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this job?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Ask about research, and paper, where got publish Futher plan, and what classes have been taken, and the paper been published before Expect salary and budget for the experiment setup
Interview Questions: How do you know UT

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: There was a simple 30-minute conversation with the lab coordinator in which they asked me about my skillset/what work I would like to be doing for this lab followed by them letting me know if I was a good fit about a week later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this lab?

title: Analytical Chemist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with one of the professors at the University of Texas, Austin, where they summarized and explained the ins and outs of how chemical research is conducted as well as its applications.
Interview Questions: I Interviewed them. Some questions were: - What applications does Chemistry have in day to day life? - How is biomedical chemistry conducted ethically? - What equipment and methods do you utilize while researching? And more

title: Senior Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application and then met with the interviewer who would be my boss. They asked some good questions about my background and we discussed the role. They were looking for someone with better technical skills and less management experience than what I had.
Interview Questions: What is your experience developing dashboards?

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, quick turnaround. Provided in-depth information on the role and requirements from the candidate. Had one initial screening before being offered an interview. Received verbal affirmation but had an extra step afterwards to secure the position.
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral questions asked one after another.

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions:
Emailed me about three weeks after applying to schedule two interviews. Both interviews were unorganized and the director was very prying and asked unrelated questions. Spelt my name wrong in a follow-up email too. Did not get an email saying I was not chosen for the job and had to find out via the portal.

Asked for feedback on my interview and application and did not hear back. Overall, not a great experience. Did not want the position anyway after speaking with them.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple deadlines?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: First, I was sent an email interview questionnaire with 10 questions and a self assessment for various skills. After 2 days, I recieved an email to schedule a virtual interview.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict in the workplace?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Good interview process with lots of interesresting question had to write essays and give alot of background about yourself. Love the school and all it stands for and it;s values
Interview Questions: Applied online and got in.

title: Orientation Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward and each of the interviewers were very kind. There was one round where I answered behavioral questions and another group interview round where we worked on an activity together and presented it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an orientation advisor?

title: Shift Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple, just asked questions and very fun. Really laid back, and asks questions looking for leaderships skills. It was several employees and the manager in the room and it was a shared interview with at least one other person interviewing.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you used leadership skills?

title: Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was initially contacted by email to set up an interview with hiring manager and one other manager. After the first interview the next interview step was with the entire team.
Interview Questions: How do you define diversity How would handle communicating to user that patches need to be performed

title: Software Developer Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1. need to get an "A" for an aptitude test. 2. phone screen interview (about 30 min). 3. panel interview (about 1 hour). Hiring decisions are made from the panel interview.
Interview Questions: all BQ questions. Passed exp.

title: Network Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: There was a first round general interview with the manager, and a second round interview with other teams members and more technical. Both were virtual. No interviews with HR or anything like that
Interview Questions: What is the difference between MST and PVST+

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively straight forward. Most of the application was submitted online, and the university seems to have a well integrated documentation system. Heard back about my status promptly
Interview Questions: Do you have any teaching or teaching assistant experience?

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioral questions. Teamwork, communications skills, diversity. strengths weakenesses, why uni of texas at austin, why this college, how are you qualified, Tell me about a time you made a decision with limited information
Interview Questions: Difficult person, what you bring to a team,

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: it was relaxed and deasy. no awkward behavioral questions. nice environment and friendly staff. I would say to brush up on your past work and know what your academic and professional goals are.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain from this experience and what are your goals after the degree?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: First I had an initial phone interview. After a few days I was contacted for a second interview. The questions were typical style of interview questions. They followed up a few days later.
Interview Questions: Tell us what interests you about this position.

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. Typical questions start off with "tell me about a time..." Interviewed with 2 supervisors in the department. They definitely value diversity. It did take a while to hear back from them, I think about 2 weeks if I remember correctly. Go for it, even if you think you're not qualified. Just be confident. They will train you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you overcame a challenge.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds - one virtual and one on-campus. Fairly straightforward for a higher ed interview process. Lots of time to meet with different teams and individually with stakeholders. The on-campus interview was a half day.
Interview Questions: Required to present a 30 minute proposal on plans for department

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: One behavioral group interview with 5+ ppl and written application with several questions about how you were qualified for the position and your involvement on campus ex. Have you ever had a job that involved working with students?
Interview Questions: Tell me one way you are involved on campus

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position and heard back within a week. Was offered a day-long interview via Zoom, similar to the traditional in-person interviews that you see for most higher ed roles. Met with various stakeholders, administrators, and students. Was offered the role by the end of the week. Entire process was about 2.5 weeks.
Interview Questions: Managing individuals from backgrounds that differ from my own and how I navigate that, goals for the position, time management, previous projects that I’ve done and what those entailed

title: UGTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: No interview, just had to find a class and talk to the professor directly. After attending the first day, the professor hired me to TA the class after asking me about my previous experience with the course materials. There is a default list of positions, but those are usually filled quickly.
Interview Questions: Grade obtained in the course?

title: Events Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions:
3 Interviews: 

1- initial phone call with the Senior Event Manager
1- with the Assistant Director, Director of Operations, and the Senior Event Manager
1- with the team; AV, Housekeeping, IT
Interview Questions: how do you handle stress?

title: Email Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, respectful and the communication was clear throughout the process. I interviewed with a recruiter over the phone as well as my manager over the phone and in-person. My manager was also flexible with my start date.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in email development?

title: Marketing Department Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It was chill, the interviewers were young one of them a student and they were all very kind. None of the questions were too deep. They offered me the job on the spot and gave me time to decline later on.
Interview Questions:
What makes you a marketer?

What’s a campaign you’ve worked on?

What’s your favorite UT campaign?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 rounds. The first is a recruiter call, where they explain more about the role and ask you basic questions like why you are interested in the role and company. The second interview is a mix of behavioral and technical. They ask you about your previous experience and how you would approach different situations and scenarios. There is a coding question, but you just have to answer with pseudo code, so it isn't too bad. I had to swap the values of two positions in an array.  After my interviews, I was told that I'd be informed about my results in a few days, which I never received. I even reached back out but did not get a response. Overall great people, and the interview wasn't too bad. I wish the communication was better.
Interview Questions: Explain previous projects you've worked on.

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was interviewed shortly after. The interviewers were very kind and reacted very positively to me. I was certain I would get a second interview. I sent a thank you note and followed up with them a week later and received no response. I never got a rejection, but they took down the posting for the job and reposted it a month later.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held over the phone. The interviewer gave an introduction and a brief job description. I was then asked some interview questions. The interview was relatively quick, lasting about 15-20 minutes.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict in the workplace before?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straightforward, they just asked questions about prior experiences with work or volunteering, as well as some basic questions to see how you would handle customer service situations.
Interview Questions: Do you have prior experience working for the university?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed a few weeks after applying. My references were called after my interview. A few weeks later (three weeks, I think) I was informed that the position had been filled by someone else.
Interview Questions: How do you keep up to date with trends and design programs?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Applying for the social work intern position was an amazing experience. It is very clear that the staff truly care about their students and gave a pretty tough interview process in reflection of that. I ultimately chose another position, but only after days of struggling the urge to say yes to UT Charter school (I have years of experience working at schools and needed to branch out). I hope the best for their Social- Emotional Learning project!
Interview Questions: How do you respond to a young child who is crying because she is scared to attend her first day of school?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a position as a computer science pod mentor. Application was long and involved multiple essays. Had a video interview which consisted of a series of vague questions with a group of about 5 candidates. Received a rejection with very little feedback. Overall the process felt incredibly impersonal.
Interview Questions: What would you do to increase participation in pod meetings? How would you highlight diversity and what is the importance of doing such to you?

title: Student Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and easy! They are more interested in how you want to grow in the position than what you can initially bring to the table. More often than not, you will be interviewed by your perspective manager.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to accomplish in this role?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: They asked general questions about academics and discussed things like work hours and such. They asked about workload and were mostly concerned about availability. They also asked about the living situations either on  campus or off campus
Interview Questions: What is your availability to work throughout the week?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was a two call interview process - the first was with recruiting heads and the second was with a panel of department heads from varying specialties. The process was held over Zoom.
Interview Questions: How would you describe an ideal team

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process with the University of Texas was very streamlined. The recruiters and the entire team was very professional. I appreciated their attentiveness and ressponsiveness, as well as the quick turn around on status updates.
Interview Questions: Creative aspects to role in development

title: Human Resources Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: A lot of the questions were really similar, so it was hard to answer some of them without being repetitive. Interview seemed a little disorganized because they would read the question with the number (i.e. Question 5 is explain a time where you worked with a difficult coworker).
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Proffesional it was very interesting to see how the interview went from easy to hard. Depending on what position was available the salaries varied but it was done in a proffesional setting in front of the interviewee. The use of how the questions
Interview Questions: What is your best quality?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process with questions and an academic presentation.  The process was very friendly and easy going. The presentation was about 45 mins with another 15 min questions and answers.
Interview Questions:
What are the future directions of HPC? 
What are the next three things you are going to work on

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Very chill loved every moment be prepared to answer every question and then just be yourself and have fun take life seriously and say what you want to achieve with the job
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself right now

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was several rounds. I got to meet several people in the department. I got asked a lot of the same questions. I had to prepare several questions to ask since there were so many interviews.  Some of the interviews were done virtually and some were done in person.
Interview Questions: What is one thing is not on your resume that you would like us to know?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: A Zoom interview with the PI. I was getting some bad vibes because she was bad-mouthing her undergrad assistants but I went ahead. She apparently listed my job title incorrectly multiple times.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have in research?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: They reached out after I applied on website. 1-1 interview with the manager. They asked related customer service experience and how you fit in to the role. They asked for new suggestions and walked through their expectations
Interview Questions: Describe what is a best customer service to you

title: Creative Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Not a bad process but asked a bunch of questions that had nothing to do with the job. Wish it turned out differently, they also were not too sure on what they were really looking for.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience coding?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I had one-one interview with faculties. At the second stage, I presented my research to the group. The presentation took about 40 min.  The interview went very smooth in general.
Interview Questions:
Explain your research briefly ? 
what is your expectations?

title: General Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview only. Never got a call back but the questions in the phone interview were the standard interview questions. The interviewer was nice enough so I was disappointed that I didn’t hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, where do you see yourself in 5 years, why are you leaving your current company.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very chill; online; on zoom They just wanted to know why I'm interested in that particular area of research, why I'd be good at it, and why the field was relevant to me
Interview Questions: why I'm interested in that particular area of research, why I'd be good at it, and why the field was relevant to me

title: Recreation Facility Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied and heard back within a few days. A lot of behavioral questions and questions on how you would handle certain situations.  Really nice people and a relaxed environment. Only interviewed by 2 people.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where something didn’t go your way, and how did you handle it?

title: Senior video content producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Got an informal text from one of the interviewers and set up the interview for the next day over zoom. Seemed very quick and scientific, but the guys were great and personable.
Interview Questions: Q. What is one project that you felt you couldve done better on and why?

title: Junior Designer/Production Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: After applying a received an email for a quick pre-screening interview. After that it was a Zoom interview with a few team members in which I was given a project to do. After that it was secondary Zoom interview with the same team members including a few others to discuss how I went about the project that was given to me. Overall it took about a month from interview to interview, but I never heard back from them since September.
Interview Questions: What is my design process? How do I time myself when starting a task?

title: PhD Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: it was around 40 minutes. I was interviewed by 4 people through zoom meeting and tried my best and answered all of the questions very well.  I got an offer after the interview
Interview Questions: about my experience and my papers

title: Social Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by the Hiring Manager about a month after submitting my application online. The initial interview was a videoconference call with the Hiring Manager. The next day, I was told that I was selected for the 2nd round group interview with the team. The interview was 1 hour long, divided into two separate 30 minute calls with different groups. 

I received a call two days after the group interview by the hiring manager who personally let me know that I wasn't selected, but he provided me feedback on why I wasn't selected and told me that while I had very strong experience, they opted to choose someone who had experience in Higher Education, which is something I lacked. He did say that there were future roles opening up that aligned with my background and that I should strongly consider applying. 

As much as applying for jobs and interviewing can be a very grueling process, this was probably the most professional and positive interview experience I've had in a long time. I really appreciated the feedback and phone calls from the hiring manager, even to tell me that I was not selected.
Interview Questions:
Can you share some ideas on how UT can improve their social media presence?

Why are you choosing to pursue a role in Higher Education?

title: Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview was structured well and the questions were appropriate for the position desired.  All interviewers were professional and well spoken.  I would recommend this university as a place to consider.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions:
What are the main findings of your PhD?
    What areas of our research interest you and why?
    How will your research fit in our department?
    How would you seek funding for your work?
    How will this postdoc help you reach your professional goals?
    Do you have an experience mentoring graduate students?
Interview Questions: A short summary of my research plan

title: Medical Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted within a week of submitting my resume for an interview. I scheduled my interview for the following day and I thought it went well. Never received a call back so I am pretty bummed but all in all it was a very easy process
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Have you used Athena before

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come in for an in-person interview with a couple people from the team that I would be working on. They asked a series of questions and offered time at the end of the interview to answer any questions I had. The interview could have been completed over zoom, but they asked me to come in.
Interview Questions: The university values diversity. Tell me about a time you worked with people who were different from you.

title: Facility Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, some semesters they do group interviews, all over zoom. You almost certainly get the job as long as you are a student. It also helps if you know another student worker or employee.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews, both 40-60 min long, mostly behavioral type interview questions. Some were specifically about my past experience or resume; others were more general, like "what's your proudest accomplishment" or "tell me about a time when you failed."
Interview Questions: What's one word you would use to describe yourself?

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I got about two months after applying asking if I was still interested, then I had a phone screen and a video interview. They then closed the position due to unforeseen circumstances.
Interview Questions: Teach us anything of interest to you in 5 minutes

title: Line Cook/Prep Cook Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was simple and they provided a lot of answers and information to the job. they also make you feel comfortable and don't give you a hard time
Interview Questions: What is something that you want to bring to the table

title: Social Media Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of initial pre-assignment. The actual interview was with people in the department. They were very nice. The interview was about 30 minutes. They responded with an offer within a week.
Interview Questions: What online communities have you managed in the past?

title: HR Coodinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: UT has different departments and recruiting is not the same for all. I was fortunate enough to have a great team. Interviews can be nerve wrecking. The leadership team made me feel at ease. The questions were your normal, basic questions.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at UT? 
What are your strengths and weaknesses? 
How are your organizational skills?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: First interview met with two small groups separately.  Second interview was more of a confirmation that I was still interested. The questions were mixed with some regarding my past experience and relevance with the open position.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had to resolve an issue and how you handled it.

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process involved a phone screen. Phone screen was about 30 minutes.

Phone screen was followed by a panel interview.
Interview questions were standard questions about experience as well as behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to work with someone who disagreed with you?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute Zoom or in-person interview between the recruitment coordinator and the department you're applying for. They ask a series of questions related to communication skills, interpersonal skills, public speaking etc.
Interview Questions: Create a presentation about yourself and what you do in your major?

title: Assistant Clinical Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
This experience was specific to the public health department within the school of ecology. I imagine the process varies by department.

From application submission to getting hired, it was a little over a month. It's been a well organized and fast-paced interview process, a welcome change to most interview processes with universities.

Standard meeting with current faculty during round 1.

 Round 2: given about 3 days to prepare a mock lecture of 30 mins.

Round 3:  writing activity.
Interview Questions: Standard questions during round 1 that allowed me to express my strengths and why I was a strong candidate for this position. I was also given an opportunity to ask questions of the faculty.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews in back-to-back weeks via video calling. Interviewers are very nice and pleasant and provided a well-balanced interview with serious work-related questions and personal questions as well to really get a good judge of character 4 personality
Interview Questions: What is a part of your personality that you don't always Express at work

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very personable, but the questions are more personal/anecdotal than one would expect. They  give lots of  “tell about a time when you...” questions rather than standard interview questions. It’s not necessarily difficult, but it is unique.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you solved a conflict between two other people.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Really good! Emphasis on Electrical and Computer Engineering is evident given their national ranking, and expect out of the box thinking in applications. They have a panel asking you  about past experience and experience in computing.
Interview Questions: What does an interrupt look like in a keyboard?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: There is a group interview process and an individual interview process. They are checking to see who is empathic, flexible and able to work on a team.  Make sure to answer the question.
Interview Questions: What was a time you helped someone through a difficult time?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Describe my experience and some related project. Explain the reason to apply for this position. Introduce some skill sets in the mental health area. Then the employer would introduce some details about this position
Interview Questions: Demonstrate the way you work as a UX designer. Provide some examples.

title: Associate Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and received an email a few weeks later to set up a time for an interview. The interview was with six people from the college and lasted about 40 minutes. I received an email a few weeks later letting me know I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: Q: What experiences do you have with academic advising in the past?

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: At such a large university, this can vary depending on department. I would say hiring committee was very pleasant and friendly. First 30 minutes were with management team. Last 30 minutes were with a larger committee from the office.
Interview Questions: How would co-workers describe you?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview wherein prospective tutors introduced themselves then were paired together. Each one taught a concept to one another while current tutors walked around performing evaluations. The atmosphere was overall relaxed and non-stressful.
Interview Questions: Tell us one interesting thing about you.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview for this job in the office assisting was streamlined, interesting, easy-going, not stressful at all.  I felt very comfortable answering my interviewer's questions and getting to know the job responsibilities.  The overall experience was delightful in that I enjoyed speaking with my potential employer and felt listened to and respected as a prospective employee.
Interview Questions: How will you be able to apply your skills to this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was late and unprepared, asked questions outside of position, never made eye contact, asked personal questions I was not comfortable that is all thirty words seems like a long amount am I done yet
Interview Questions: I don't remember any of them at all

title: High School College Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rigorous and lasted about an hour in total. Very in-depth and open! It is not for the week, as any significant mess up will lead to an ending of the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your reason for joining?

title: Admissions Reader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over Zoom and it lasted about 30 minutes. The person interviewing me was very kind and we got along well. Questions were more related to the position rather than subjective behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with confidentiality, more specifically the privacy of studentst?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a former professor to teach a studio. I took about 7 hours per work to teach in person and spent many more hours preparing. I earned $6500 for the semester.
Interview Questions: Because they knew my work they didn’t have many questions. They simply wanted to know how I would juggle teaching and professional practice

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back the same evening, which is almost unheard of. They asked me to complete a test Marketing project and submit it by the following evening to move to the next round. I was accepted to the next round which was a 1 hour interview session with the heads of the department. They were professional, kind, and easy-going. I then was moved to the second round which involved a 3 hour online interview with various people from the department. There were about 10 people on the video call, many of which were completely checked out. This made it difficult to have an effective interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to solve a problem.

title: Cultural Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The coordinator for summer programs reached out to me via email. Then we had a 1:1 interview where I was asked questions about my personality and how well I get along with others. I was also asked situational questions of managing a large group of students in excursions that will occur in a different city.
Interview Questions: Describe one tough situation that you encountered and how you dealt with it?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It is also in the package of your Ph.D. track here so there is no such "real" interview. But UT will offer you a course that helps you to get prepared for TA work.
Interview Questions: (As I described above, there is no such "real" interview.)

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It really was a simple interview. Asked about general skills related to work that would be done in the lab. Very kind, helped explain what the lab does and what the work I would be doing was.
Interview Questions: Are you good with tools?  Are you good at working with your hands?

title: Innovation Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty positive experience: online application, and a phone interview, and I heard back within 2 weeks.  I would recommend interviewing in-person (if possible) to see if this is a position that you like and want to do. I would highly recommend it for students to do during the school year!
Interview Questions: How do you deal with ambiguity?

title: IT Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I received an email that they deleted the job position ?!?!? It seems they do not have any plan so I don’t like to put myself in the risky situation
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview went great. Asked some standard behavioral questions. Asked me what I liked the most about the University of Texas at Austin. The interviewer was really nice. He was a fellow student.
Interview Questions: What do you like about UT.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview that lasted 30 minutes which included time for me to ask questions. Six interviewers including one graduate students. Two faculty from Studies department, the rest from practitioners.
Interview Questions: How would you teach an intro class.

title: Assistant Director Instructional Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very brief. Twenty minute panel interview for the initial screen with no time for any of my own questions.  Followed by a 1 hour panel interview where I was asked to give a presentation of my 90 day entry plan, along with potential management scenarios. Again almost no time for my own questions. Interview questions were very rote. There was a very strange vibe to the interview. Interviewers seemed disinterested. No response to follow up regarding status. After research discovered they chose an internal candidate so it appears I may have been a filler candidate to lend credibility to position search. Very disappointed that I had time my wasted and was treated so disrespectfully for this level of a position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Assistant Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple and quick process. I applied with my resume. I then sat down for a single face to face interview. I was offered the job the same day.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this job instead of other campus jobs?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: You need to find the faculties and talk to them individually. They tell you their project and if that matches your area of interest and if they have funding, they can hire you.

Is this the area of interest?
Are you willing or do you want to publish articles in the future?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I had two video interviews. The first with the supervisor and the second with both my supervisor and her manager. They were so friendly and made the whole process very smooth and relaxing.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background, why I want to get that position. What do I know about that position and the job description.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. Tell me about yourself, your strengths, and weaknesses. Everyone I interacted with was super kind and efficient during the hiring process. It was an easy interview, but would recommend studying up on the lab’s research ahead of time.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: If you are a student, it is a super easy interview with basic questions about customer service. They will probably hire you on the spot and ask when you can start.
Interview Questions: What is customer service to you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Go into office, have interview in front of panel at a conference room setting. They are very nice and take turns asking questions. It's hard to feel like you connect with any one of them.

title: Finance Interview

Overall a negative experience, it seems they weren't sure what they wanted, I asked a few question from the job description and they couldn't answer them.

title: PhD Student Interview

title: Student Associate Interview

title: Director of Marketing Interview

title: Student Security Coordinator Interview

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview

title: Graphic Designer Interview

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview

Con

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: went well. they asked me simple questions but challenging enough to qualify me. I found out about them through a class but they had applicants who weren't UT affiliated. overall it was a good experience
Interview Questions: how did you hear about us

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Took 3 weeks before I got called. 

1) The manager of the position I applied for called me. Had a 30 minute phone interview with her. She was impressed and moved me to the next round which was to speak with the Director. This took 2 weeks. (Round 1)

2) Director called me for a 30 minute phone interview (Round 2). Passed with flying colours and she re-iterated that she would love to bring me in for the third round. 

3) Met with the team on campus (Round 3). Took 1 hour. Shook hands, smiled, answered questions, and figured I got the offer.

4) My references were contacted and all gave raving reviews. I was looking forward to receiving the offer based on the interactions and follow-up emails after the interviews. Everyone was engaged BUT.....

They closed the position due to budget restrictions out of no where. I had to follow up and ask when they would be making a final decisions. I asked after my references gave me the go-ahead a week later. I e-mailed the manager and asked for an update but in a rude way she replied "sorry the position is closed we wish you the best on your career ahead". I swear I knocked this interview out of the park. Just wasn't meant to be I guess. Words of advice, give it your all at interviews but don't put your emotions into it...its just another job.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
How do you recruit corporate partners?
Tell us 2 things your former supervisors would say about you?
What do you know about UT?
I had to present a PPT in the role of a outreach coordinator and the panel were potential companies. Impressed them.
List anything we should know about you that is not on your resume?
Why do you want to work for UT?

title: Arts and Entertainment Technologies Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
My first interview was a skype interview and lasted about 7 minutes, very cut and dry basic interview questions. 
My second interview was held on campus at UT. I had to create a presentation in which I taught a five minute presentation. I thought the second interview went ok and was informed I would know after the weekend about the committees decision for the role. I did not hear anything from them until I called (four weeks later) in which I talked to a very rude woman in the strategies and policy office. She informed me that the position had already been filled, but seemed a bit confused about what position I was inquiring about. 
After that I was still not certain if the job was filled or not. After a couple of emails and a voicemail that I had left, I still have heard nothing and the position and still says open on the HR website. This is the most unprofessional institution that I have dealt with this far. If you are not going to hire someone please communicate that to them in a timely manner, or at least answer an email.
Interview Questions: Where do you think the music we listen to on our phone comes from?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I had the interview on phone. It was casual and relaxing. The professor was very friendly and did not ask hard questions. She asked some questions about details in my resume and some lifestyle questions.
