Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to mediate a conflict between other people.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Dallas, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: onsite interview, ask about your leadership, communication skills, problem solving skills , time management skills.  supervisor are very nice and helpful. Prepare the Behavior questions and you will be fine. Be confident and well prepared
Interview Questions: Tell me about your time management skills

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview: 30min long conversation about research experience. 
2. Onsite interview: A week after the phone interview, the onsite interview was offered. 1hour long presentation summarizing my Ph.D work was requested. Offer was given right after the end of the onsite interview. The offer letter was sent in a few days.
Interview Questions: Is the work that you've done driven by your idea?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions:
Send the resume after taking the class, then was asked to Meet the professor after the class, ask some basic questions abour my previous experimence and what I would like to accomplish after graduation, 
got the opportunity to join his group in the first month, get the GRA for the next semester.
Interview Questions: What do you want to accomplish after graduation

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Team interview and one-on-one interviews. Just like for any program coordinator position within UT Austin. However they dodged any qn regarding the reason as to why the previous person who had held this position left.
Interview Questions: Standard HR questions.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Visit campus and laboratory, talk to other lab members, give a seminar on previous research projects. Should make sure that the seminar is thorough and you look professional. The process and difficulty is really dependent on the lab you are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: How would you purify DNA?

title: Orientation Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process includes three portions: A formal interview, a "Show and tell" piece where you talk about different leadership experiences, and a third piece where you do a team project with a group of roughly five people. The formal interview portion takes place in a panel setting, with multiple returning advisors judging your questions. The presentation of leadership experiences is the craftiest portion and the easiest to prepare for because they provide the prompts beforehand. This is also where you can choose to exhibit your skills through the container. The group project occasionally changes, but this year it was a lego challenge. It's simple enough, so long as you are decent at communicating without being overpowering.
Interview Questions: What does leadership mean to you? How would you address campus safety? How should the university address diversity? More questions, very similar to the application.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Houston, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Intially sent emails to cue their interest.  A few days later had a scheduled phone interview. A few days after that had a face-to-face.  Met with part of the team for Q&A and then a prepared presentation in the presentation room. Was good overall.  Be sure to have a full presentation with hand-outs, audience interaction, and a structure presentations
Interview Questions:
* How did you turn around a bad situation?
* What is your greatest professional accomplishment?
* How has your work background prepared you for this job?

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were work ethic questions. And, then there were technical questions on an exam. And then I was asked if there was anything I couldn't do that they should know about. And, I said I have a little bit of vertigo.
Interview Questions: How would I design a fail-safe system to power a motor.

title: Learning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process consisted of a phone interview followed by a half day attendance on campus with group interviews, a presentation, and a final interview. I was contacted by the hiring department to set up an interview date and then sent instructions for preparing a presentation. Day of interview, given instructions on where to park, was given breakfast although I was too nervous to really eat ( a nice gesture but perhaps not entirely considerate), and given a brief tour of the department.

During the actual interview, I was given an empty office to leave my things and supposedly relax during the different interview sections, but I wasn't left there long enough to take a breather, I thought. First portion of interview consisted of the presentation I was to give in front of staff and student employees. Was a somewhat large group of people, although I was warned of that.

Afterwards, large group asked me many questions regarding the position. Was given a ten minute break in empty office, then moved to another smaller group interview. Finally was moved to another interview with department head and then released.

Interview was fine, but the follow-up process was not. After a month of not hearing anything, I reviewed my application in the EID section on the UT HR website where a note said I was sent a rejection notice. I had not received said notice, so I emailed hiring department to inquire and was ignored. Still have not received notice and was never responded to by hiring department. Although it's fine I was not hired for the position, I think it was rather unprofessional to be ignored, particularly when I was responsible for preparing a 20 minutes presentation that I spent a week preparing and when the staff was otherwise very receptive to my questions before the interview.
Interview Questions: If you were asked to prepare a staff meeting for the other specialists to draft a training program for the student employees, what would it look like?

title: Library Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
As a student, I simply go to the library and talk to the managers about the work opportunity.
They simply asked about my basic skills and academic information. Nothing too complicated.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with customer service?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Standard hour long interview with two different nurse managers reading from a pre-determined list of questions around a table. Both were engaged during the process and took me around the different departments. They were interviewing me preemptively of a position opening based on my resume for a similar position.
Interview Questions: Asked about a period of difficulty in my lifetime and how it had affected me

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was unusually intense for such a low level position. I was interviewed by 3 people in just under an hour. They asked a series of questions from a paper in which they filled in your answer as you spoke. The interviewers were very nice and welcoming, once the questions began I started to relax.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond for a customer.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I did not have interview and the offer was based on other aspects such as SOP and exam scores. After I get accepted, I had a qualifying exam in the second year of graduate school. The exam was not difficult and the committees are very helpful to figure out/ solve problems.
Interview Questions: They asked me to calculate the number of magnons at room temperature.

title: Research Fellos Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor for the position invited me for lunch and asked me about my research experience and if I have peer reviewed papers. It was a very informal interview. The supervisor was a very nice and respectful person.
Interview Questions: If I wrote peer reviewed papers while in my previous position

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview. In person Interview with 3 people. Went well offered position took 2 months for hire to go through. Were very communicative during the waiting period but unable to expedite process.
Interview Questions: Experience with Genetic Testing

title: Undergraduate Writing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was done through internship course; actual interview was very brief. Process was very straightforward and interviewer was very personable. The interview occurred at the Writing center, which was a very welcoming environment.
Interview Questions: What three words would you use to describe yourself

title: International Studies Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed twice for the same position & never given an offer. Word on the street is that they give preference to UT Alums and like to hire internally. That's fine, but don't post a vacancy publicly in that case.
Interview Questions: Generic questions, nothing overly challenging

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Nothing more than online application. After you are accepted for Ph.D degree all the student meet all the professor and then you will fill a list of your preferences (pref. for adviser and research topic)
Interview Questions: Statement of purpose, recommendation letters

title: Recruitment Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process varies depending on the department. The department I interviewed with consisted of an in person interview with the interview team. From the date of applying online, it took about a month to have my application reviewed and be scheduled for an interview. Once interviewed it took about a month to complete the process.
Interview Questions: I was asked standard interview questions.

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: A very relaxed talk with the IT head. The conversation consisted of my experience with computer hardware, the apple ecosystem, and general conversation about my interests and why I wanted to apply for this position.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with the Mac ecosystem and environment.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Email the professor of which the class you're interested in TA-ing. The professor will setup an interview if necessary. Probably he/she will need to see all candidates. After that, most professors will contact the candidates about whether or not they will hire you. However, different departments may have different type of process. In some depts, the graduate coordinator will handle every TA allocation, rather than the professors themselves.
Interview Questions: Have you taken this class? What's your grade? How confident you are in something.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my research background during my time as an undergraduate and was also asked about my test scores. There were almost no behavioral questions, it was mostly about technical aspects of my research.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe my research as if I was explaining it to a high school student.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was calm and cordial with specific questions on the job at hand. The job description was also mentioned and the current problems that needed to be resolved were described in detail.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in programming?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview then In Person Interview. The phone interview was actually using Skype so it was a video conference interview because I live out of town.  The in person interview included a panel of department leadership as well as  a person who was recently hired.  I'm doubting that person answered the questions I was asked.
Interview Questions: Were not standard.  They were super specific to the position as if I were already int he role and being asked what my plan of action was for the project without any additional knowledge.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very task oriented. They want to know what you can do in terms of previous job tasks. Also, they take a very long time getting back to potential candidates, making it difficult to schedule interviews once they do decide who they are going to interview. Lengthy process for little payout, especially for entry level positions!
Interview Questions: What about your work history fits the role of this position?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: There was no real interview process just an application and questions about what you want to do in the future. There is no real interview process, you just talk to the Research Educator about your future plans and what project you'd like to work on during the summer from there he will consider your best fit.
Interview Questions: Will you have any other obligations over the summer?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Questions pertaining to research interests, programs, codes, all technical information what type of program would you use for this type of data, analysis, etc. Have you read our paper? what did you think ? where are the holes ??
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and thorough- come prepared. You will most likely interview with multiple individuals on a panel across departments. They are big on culture and the right fit. They promote from within or from the UT network so having a connection and the experience will more than likely get you the job. If you do not have a connection, still apply but know that you may be up against a large network of highly qualified and connected individuals.
Interview Questions: Job history, explain transitions, strengths/weaknesses- the normal questions but they dig a little deeper.

title: Desktop Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very scripted. Questions were broad and didn't really test job-specific knowledge. It was a bit painful, to be honest and felt completely fake. Two people were in the room. I really think they would have hired anyone, a lesson I soon learned when I got the job and started engaging with my co-workers.
Interview Questions: Has there been a time when you ___? How did you respond?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It was a research internship, so there was no interview. Instead, we had an application and 3 recommendation letters. In addition, each applicant submitted a cover letter that described their research interests, and then indicated any interest in any field they had. Other than that, there wasn't much else to it. I heard back from the admissions department in about a month's time.
Interview Questions: No questions. It was a research internship application.

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was good! They have a very good system. Very clear process from beginning to end. I don't have anything else to say but you're making me type 30 words.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The process itself took a few weeks.  Interview process (1) Phone Interview with 2 staff members (2) Face-to-face interview with staff members and executive assistant.  I passed the interview process and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses, standard interview questions.

title: Pilot Plant Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, in person conversation. Laid back interview that focused more on why I wanted the role and the hours that I could contribute on a weekly basis. How much hands on experience I did or didn't have didn't seem to matter.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended by a friend. It was very easy process. I contacted the supervisor. Send her my resume and she called for interview. I went and she asked me if I am flexible to work certain hours. I said yes and I god the job
Interview Questions: Are you flexible to work?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief 30 minute interview. Generic situational questions where you describe past work experiences and how you overcame certain challenges to meet an end goal. You can prepare with general prep by having solid responses regarding your resume and experience.
Interview Questions: When was a time you faced adversity on a team?

title: Senior Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my previous experience, skills, and what it was like to work for my past employers.  What things I most liked or disliked about my previous positions and various other questions. It was easy going and friendly.
Interview Questions: What did you like most about your previous position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Setup an interview with a Professor I wanted to work with. Read his recent publications. He spoke to me about his future research directions. Felt like I would be a good fit in the team.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research and not take up a full-time job?

title: Assistant Director for Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a half-day process with multiple meetings, which was actually helpful because it offered the opportunity to meed a much broader sample of offices and other groups I would be working with once I took the post. The meetings were informative, interesting and offered the opportunity for me to ask lots of questions as well.
Interview Questions: Can you give specific examples of how you worked with a team to execute a significant project?

title: Participant - 3D Environment Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: One hour phone interview. I was thoroughly questioned by one of three people over behavioral stuff at first. Later, he went deeper into leadership quality questions. He also purposely tried to steer me away from my comfort zones. In the end, I was briefly questioned by the other two people on the line about questions I had and what I expected from the program.
Interview Questions: List some of the ways in which you acted like a leader in a project other than [project I had the most experience in].

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: very casual, just asked me about stuff that was listed in my resume.  I got a call back about a week later.  Honestly, it was just a work-study job, so I just offered cheap labor.  It helped that I was a math major working in the math library.  I learned a lot. The interview was also extremely short maybe not more than fifteen minutes.  Other than that, don't sweat it at all, but still take it seriously though, since a lot of people need work study and on campus jobs can get really competitive.  Also don't look at your phone and make a lot of eye contact so you can come off as genuine
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult situation in your last workplace

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: If you're not interviewing for a professor position, you're treated like a student by their HR pricess. It was a waste of time...1 hr long phone interview with two participants, followed by 1 hr in person interview on campus with a panel. Friendly people w typical experience questions, yet,  months later, never even received the courtesy of a canned standard rejection email. Unprofessional.
Interview Questions: please go over your background (experience and education) and how it fits this position

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview reviewing the previous papers written by the lab to make sure that you understand the goals of the lab. We spent about 20 minutes talking about the actual lab work and 40 minutes chit-chatting. Overall the interview was easy, but the work was challenging and fun. This could easily vary depending on who your supervisor is so prepare accordingly.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work as a research assitant?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I literally just walked into a couple of professor's offices and sent emails and find a professor to do research with pretty quickly. There was really no "interview" process, really. I don't know if any professor formally interviews their students, it seems like most professors at UT are actually quite eager to recruit students if they have room for them. I know professor's will check your file before they decide to hire you on as a graduate student.
Interview Questions: They asked what sort of research I was interested in.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First round interviews were conducted on the phone with three individuals working in the department, not the actual supervisor or director themselves. The phone interview was about half an hour long, and was very informal; The individuals interviewing me were very relaxed and were asking questions that gauged whether or not I could be a prospective employee that could move up in the department. Two to three days later I received an email stating that I would be interviewed in person with the supervisor and the associate director. The day of, I was asked some general background employment information, but not as extensively as the phone interview. The questions asked were more hypothetical "what would you do?" situations, and since the job I applied for is more team work based, how I handle and work as a team player. Overall, the associate director and the supervisor were very pleasant, gave great feedback which I know some departments on campus who interview do not do that.
Three to four days later I received a call to join the team.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a situation where you have a repeat student caller who is upset about not being admitted to the University?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: two Skype interviews. Didn't expect it but turned out a full table of staffs working in that office were interviewing me and each one of them asked me a question.
Interview Questions: Give us an example when students complaint and how you handled it.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three interviewees, balanced character questions, very professional. Interviewed with head of HR, administrative manager and co-worker. UT is a wonderful place and offers many options whether you're goal is to stay long term, or gain experience and transition into other sectors.
Interview Questions: Are you a "big picture" person, or a "little picture" person?

title: Part-time Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview for a part-time graphic designer student position for an editorial project. I brought my portfolio and we chatted about some of the projects. There were two people who interviewed me and they mainly wanted to see how my experience was relevant to what they needed. The atmosphere was relaxed and friendly.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: You first pick Professor you want to work and contact him/her. Send an email to introduce yourself and ask for a discussion/meet to say about research problem he/she has. Go to the office and interview!
Interview Questions: Grade until now and research experience

title: Human Resources Representative - Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the online job portal and was contacted by email with an offer for an interview. I interviewed with a panel consisting of 15-20 people, 2 different sets of panelists.  I felt very comfortable and welcomed and was able to answer the questions with ease.  They hired from within.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where I had to deal with a difficult customer, how was it resolved.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: During office hours, He asked if I would like to do research with him because I was getting really great grades in his class. There really wasn't much to it other than that. I don't think that I would've gotten the offer though if I had just been preforming at an average level.
Interview Questions: There wasn't really a formal interview process, but he did ask me about my background and past work experience and what classes I liked best

title: Contracts Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: When I was initially contacted to set-up the interview, I was told that I would be speaking to two people over the phone. However, when the interview began there were six people on the conference call and I had no idea who was asking me each question. It was all very scenario driven with none of the typical getting to know you type questions. After I answered each question, they were silent as they took notes, so there were a lot of awkward silences. At one point they even put me on mute for a while, which was pretty shocking. I prepared pretty significantly, but I still found the questions very difficult. Overall, not a good experience, but I think it varies pretty significantly from each department.
Interview Questions: What would you want to include in the Warranties provision of an SaaS contract?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The whole process has taken weeks to months (for two different jobs). The (+) sign at the end of the compensation bracket is a lie. There is no room for negotiation and they can't pay well because of the bureaucracy of UT. People were nice, but it was a waste of time for the money they were willing to offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you've had to work with difficult people and how you accomplished your goal.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and painless. It was as easy as walking in and asking for the job. You really just have to be persistent and keep looking for a professor that needs undergraduate labor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: As an international student, need to prepare transcripts from schools, Statement of Purpose aiming for the interested fields for phd program specifically, TOEFL test, GRE, GRE subject, Recommendation letters. No interview actually.
Interview Questions: Purely paper survey.

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit application with a resume and recommendation letters. Very simple. The director was open for questions at any time. Current workers loved to sit down and explain the job. Overall, it was super easy.
Interview Questions: Future goals?

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy; one on one then an additional one on one with superiors. Very easy going and if you are qualified, you shouldn't have any problem getting the job unless you have the social skills of a toaster. A lot of free coffee, snacks, etc. Definitely use the restroom beforehand because you'll be waiting in the lobby for what feels like hours on end.
Interview Questions: What is your dream job?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied two weeks before I was contacted, set up interview over the phone, came in at the end of the week. Interview lasted about an hour. The person interviewing me seemed a bit unorganized and didn't know what specific questions to ask.
Interview Questions: How can your past experiences be translated to this position?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long and drawn out; phone interview (wait 2 weeks) in person interview (wait 2 weeks) actually still waiting to hear back from them if I was the candidate selected. They contacted my references told me they'd be 1-2 weeks getting back...still no word. Extensive; 4 part process for in person interview. Panel interview, 3 one-on-one interviews with team members/managers, building tour, simulations (role playing and more).
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deliver difficult news.

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Goes through your resume, focusing on interaction with others, how well you work in a group. You discuss your technical experiences and skills. Overall the interview process is pretty simple, no technical questions. May be one interviewer or two, but not very formal, pretty relaxed.
Interview Questions: Describe your experiences working with hardware.

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a position with Liberal Arts ITS Classroom Support. I was asked within a week to interview in person at their office when they opened (6:00 AM). The interview was straightforward and I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with the Mac OS X and Windows operating systems?

title: Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard.  First a telephone screening, then a three person panel interview followed by a several part written test portion, then a second panel interview with the entire team and director.  The contact was friendly throughout the process, as was each person I met.  The panel team asked interesting questions, some behavioral.  Following two interviews, I would have expected some sort of final response, but there was no further contact, not even a boilerplate rejection email.
Interview Questions: What would you do if the supervisor advised you to change your assessment and you did not agree with it?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Actually, it wasn't an interview so much as they solicited me to do it. The interview was easy, I just was honest about my experience. That was how I was able to secure the job. Make sure that you know how to be honest about your skills. This is very important. Also make sure to dress well. Do not look like a slob. It is important to make sure you take care of that.
Interview Questions: What did you like about the class?

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Its a simple resume drop and then you get an email to interview with the IT Manager. He brings you in and asks you some questions. Then he responds and sends you a confirmation or rejecting a few days later.
Interview Questions: What would you do if (this) happened?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a supervisor and head lifeguard on the pool deck. The interview was fairly informal and only took around 30 minutes. It included a tour of the facility, some questions about my personality and theoretical questions about my teamwork abilities as well as questions related to life guarding skills.
Interview Questions: How do you make sure you are guarding effectively while on duty?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a full day. I met with several professors probably 5 or 6. We talked mainly about science and the program in general. There was a lunch where we could interact with fellow students who were also interviewing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past research?

title: Software Developer/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: A call from recruiter, then in person interview. Question about my self, and some junior question in JAVA and Linux. Mostly review my resume with Manager. Than talk with two Engineers about my teamwork, if I share and help in the work. Interview was not difficult, to my surprise
Interview Questions: What is a class?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Notified through email and schedule an appointment with the boss in advance.
Talk with the boss about the questions on the application form in detail
It only last about 10 minutes and convince him you are the one they are looking for
Interview Questions:
What make you a great tutor
Tell me a little bit of your tutoring experience before

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The turnaround was quick - within a day of sending in my resume, I got a request for an interview. The interview was straightforward, with questions about my interests and goals, my working style, and my schedule. The interviewer was very kind and wanted to make sure that the position would work with school and my other obligations.
Interview Questions: What is your interest in this office?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: A tell about my recent research, when I study in Moscow institute of Physics and Technology and about my experience as undergraduate research assistant in Lebedev Physical institute RAS, also about my work in sales position in IBM Russia System X.
Interview Questions: How difficult was study in Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology in department of General and Applied Physics

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two over the phone interviews, one in person interview and one presentation. I also had to submit an extensive amount of research materials and annotate findings. I was told to provide what my schedule would consist of what areas of research I would contribute to.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research activity?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Did not have to interview at all. It was a research position so I just asked a professor if I could join his  lab. He said yes so I joined that day. Thats all really. Not more to say here. Thanks and good by.
Interview Questions: there were none. It was a university position for an undergrad at that university to no questions to answer.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Very simple process for me.  The professor knew me and asked for me by name.  Most professors just wait for assignments to come in randomly and will tell the students they can't request by name.  Don't take it personally.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to code?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The professor was quite aloof. We sort of chatted and the job was mine. The position was mine without much effort given my previous interactions with the professor. So really that is the key in the academic environment often is just be known to these folks.
Interview Questions: No questions

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Got a call a week after applying for an interview 2 days later. Business dress was a good assumption. Friendly faces. 50 minutes with a panel of 5: 4 future teammates + supervisor. 13 easy, scripted, and predictable questions. 1 strength, 1 weakness, a time when you...
Interview Questions: How do you keep yourself organized?

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview focuses on professionalism. If you have the ability to maintain your work/life balance, then make sure to show that in your interviews. The team is really looking for someone who will make the university look good and will be able to keep up with school and their work.
Interview Questions: Please describe a time when you had to show extreme attention to detail.

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume, took about a week for them to respond. They call you for an on-the-spot phone interview, but it's not bad. They'll say to come to a two-day training and after that, you'll get the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I applied to this job online. The PI phoned me about a week later, inquiring about my experience, whether I wished to work full time or part time, and what my goals were long term.
Interview Questions: I was surprised to be asked whether I wished to work part time for a full time job posting. I was also taken aback by the bored PI. It seemed he phoned me because he had to. Finally it was most unexpected to be phoned on my mobile out of the blue.

title: I Applied for A Graduate Research Assistant Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had an interview with several potential advisers. I was not sure who would be my actual adviser. The selection process took 6 weeks and involved ranking my top choices and being matched with the advisers top choices.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research and what you would be interested in here.

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The application was posted on a university job bank. I delivered a cover letter, resume, and letter of recommendation. I received a call in less than a week and set up an interview. Interview was about 15-20 minutes long of behavioral questions and job availability questions. No hard questions and not a stressful environment.
Interview Questions: Would you report a coworker for violating the contract or ethics rules?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional ; I had to visit multiple times due to availability of the potential advisor even though I had been scheduled for interview ahead of time; lack of proper directions and admin inputs
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Help Desk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The interview process had two individuals, typically a hiring manager and an individual in the same position you would be interviewing for in the interview. The response process took some time, approximately 1 month, and from there approximately 2-3 months to configure the paperwork to be signed and dated.
Interview Questions: You look over and see your coworker on Facebook. How do you react?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I sent the PI an Email, then we exchanged several emails, then we did Skype Interview, then I was invited to do the on-site. I met every group members, each for 30 mins, and I gave a presentation about my research. After that, we had another Skype meeting about research project and
Interview Questions: Asked to give a presentation, and also talked to the group members

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: After I get admitted into my department, I send an email to apply for the graduate research assistant of my current supervisor. I had an appointment with her through email. During the meeting in her office, she mainly asked me about my resume and checked my transcript. She also introduced more about the current research projects in the group. She agreed to take me directly after the talk. And I also accepted the offer
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I came with my resume at the PCL and went to several departments looking for a part-time job as a student. When I went to the Digitization department the supervisor asked a few questions then scheduled an interview. During the interview I got a tour of the facilities, was asked about my availability then offered a job.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: A/V Technician Student Activity Center Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Invited for a one time interview after my resume was reviewed. Talked about my past experience and my current interests. Most of the duties would be learned on the job, and the most important part was that my personality fit with the team dynamic.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: applied on campus, a few weeks later, took an aptitude test on a selected subject, then few days later, went in for a mock interview. a few weeks later, I received an email of acceptance.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: They Called Me Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: After many months of applying to jobs anywhere and everywhere I recieved a call from a department at UT that I hadn't even applied to. It turns out they kept my resume in circulation and eventually it found a place. The process from there was pretty quick and easy. 1 phone interview, on in person interview and I was working the next week. It was a bit sobering that they posted the position AFTER offering me the job, which means most of the opportunities that you see from the outside aren't really there.
Interview Questions: how much should be paid?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Was a quick and very straightforward process overall. They got back to me after sending in my resume within a week and scheduled the interview within a month of me sending them my initial application. This was all in line with the time-frame described in the initial job posting and easy to go through. The interview itself was actually quite short and acted mostly to confirm and expand upon my previous experiences listed in my resume. The interviewers were also my soon to be bosses which helped me understand what would be expected of me for the job instead of just having a person with little connection to the day to day work from HR doing the interview which can be all too common nowadays.
Interview Questions: Asking what I wanted to get out of this job and what they could do to help me attain those goals.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The first is searching job online, submit my application online. Then got contacted by the boss and scheduled an phone interview. Discussing with the boss on the phone about the position, working, environment, my future plan and his expectation. Setting up the onsite interview and fly to Austin for an interview, finally got the offer.
Interview Questions: What do you want to move to Texas?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: The initial process went fairly smoothly overall two interviews with the same person, first on the phone and then via Skype since I was not in the area. II received notice the job had been canceled around the same time I was supposed to hear back whether I had got the position or not and received a vague email from the administrative assistant, I saw it was re-posted the next day and when I emailed my interviewer received a one sentence response with no real explanation, only  that they were still in the process of screening candidates.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult or unexpected, mainly about  my experience, what I could bring to the position and why I wanted to work there.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: 1 prelim 1-on-1 interview and 1 group interview. The interview process will differ by department, however. All jobs are applied for over the website, and sometimes additional documentation is required. You have to upload your resume data to the application website, but also have the option of attaching a PDF.
Interview Questions: I don't remember, because it was a long time ago now. It was some standard inteview questions, such as whether you can work in a team and where you see yourself in 5 years. Now I'm here well beyond 5 years and in such a static environment that my boss had to retire for me to advance. Advancement is difficult here in general.

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: First, you have to apply online through their system. The hiring manager contacted me a month later so it takes a while. They asked me the typically interview questions, about weaknesses and strengths. The curveball was when they asked me what I would do in specific scenarios. The managers there were really conversational but I could tell they wanted someone more experienced.
Interview Questions: If someone were to walk into your office, and ask where another department was, how would you handle the situation?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Started work as a temp. It took a week to get a call and an interview. I had two interviews: one at the temp. office and another one with the manager I would work. The decision was very fast. I started work sooner than expected. Great experience.
Interview Questions: Questions about the work experience as in the resume.  Very straightforward, honest interview.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: We contact by emails, and my boss very is nice. We talked about my new project in UT Austin. And about my benefits and salary issue. It is very helpful. The stuff from department is also very helpful! It is a nice experience.
Interview Questions: your project and your plan

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: If you are admitted to grad school its basically a shoo in but you are really being interviewed for your group (if you are going for natural sciences).  They wine and dine you to make you feel special but its really an evaluation period.
Interview Questions: You are asking the questions mostly.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview process in which I contacted my desired lab and was able to schedule an interview within days. The university's descriptions of available lab openings made it simple to see which ones best suited my abilities and which I felt most excited about.  When it was time to meet with the PI, we met in her lab and she described the multitude of studies they were running at the time.  She asked me what study sounded most exciting to me and what skills I could add to the team.
Interview Questions: What drew you to our lab?

title: ITS Job Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: took me to question twice and i did a phone interview then I did an inperson interview. they want to see if you're friendly, was not a bad experience, the boss lady was really nice and I had a great great time.
Interview Questions: what do you do if you're talking to a grandpa who doesn't know how to use internet explorer but wants to check his mail?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: very short with panel of 8
Interview Questions: situational questions regarding experience

title: Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Emailed application and resume, got an email back and scheduled a phone interview. Interview was quick, less than 20 minutes, questions about yourself, some behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: A specific question about a movie you dislike and how you would convince someone to go watch it because that's basically the job you're applying for, except you're asking for money.

title: Library Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: In person, two round interview, with a lot of cataloguers present. They quiz you about experience, and education background. Be prepared to answer a varied type of questions. In person, two round interview, with a lot of cataloguers present. They quiz you about experience, and education background. Be prepared to answer a varied type of questions.
Interview Questions: Questions about cataloguing and education experience.

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average, nothing too complicated. They asked the regular questions that one will more than likely get asked at any other job interview. There were plenty of positions open, so I think just as long as you did well on the interview you would get an offer.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses? A time you've had to overcome an disagreement with a peer? What's your availability?

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied by referral from student organization.It was very quick, but informative interview process. I accepted it to help out international students. They also required a demo presentation of a study abroad program.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to intern with us?

title: Graduate Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and heard back within a week. The hiring manager asked when I was available for a Skype interview and we arranged a time. I didn't really know what kinds of questions to prepare for and wasn't given any heads up about who would be present for the interview, etc. 

The Skype interview went fairly well. It was the hiring manager (who I'd been corresponding with already and an HR rep). There were some basic questions pertaining to my career history and key aspects of my most recent position. A few random questions such as what was the most recent thing I learned and why. They gave me an opportunity to ask questions and I had a few. 

My final question was about the next steps in the hiring process. The hiring manager stated that she unfortunately couldn't give me a good idea of when/what they were doing next as they JUST started the interviewing process. I was fine with that and was prepared to wait a week or more to hear anything. Well, I got an email the next day that said they appreciated my interest but they had HIRED someone for the position... Within one day of apparently just starting the interviewing process! So, my only thoughts are that they must have had an internal candidate who they were pretty set on before they even began interviewing. 

Overall it was a positive experience. Both people I spoke with were really nice. I would've appreciated a little more honesty in the hiring process though.
Interview Questions: What is something you've learned recently and why.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Written application, standardized test scores, undergrad transcripts.  Recruitment weekend followed for accepted students
Interview Questions: No formal interview; recruitment weekend

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Met with immediate supervisor and dean.
Interview Questions: What are you currently reading?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by PI after having applied for different position for a brief phone interview. In person interview itself consisted of 1:1 meeting with PI, Assistant Director, and other PIs relevant to the project, tour of the facilities, plus "working" lunch. I was also asked to give a ~1 hour research presentation in an open seminar forum.
Interview Questions: Given your very different background, why are you interested in this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
What an interview is like really depends on the department and how savvy they are at interviewing people. The head HR office is not involved in the process. UT staff are not very well educated about what questions they legally can/cannot ask.
Before being hired, I interviewed for an event assistant position at UT and the woman asked me only a few questions and took very little interest in my answers. I left with the realization that she already knew who she wanted for the position and was just doing the obligatory round of interviews. My assumption proved to be correct, as the rejection letter I received said they had selected an internal candidate. 
My interview with my department was a bit tougher. The first round was a phone interview with the Director. This was followed by a single in-person visit to the office which consisted of an interview with the Director alone and then an interview with the department members I would be assisting, then closure with the Director. The team was not very friendly but the questions were fairly standard. I was hired for the position. My teammates are awkward and do not know how to interview people or what to ask. These days we take it fairly easy on candidates with the questions we ask. The interviews are definitely easier than when I was hired. Having the team interview candidates is fairly pointless because while the Director hears our feedback, he hires people whose personalities are similar to his and whether or not it looks like they will stay in the department for a while.
Interview Questions: I think the most difficult question is always something along the lines of, do you get along with others, or how do you deal with conflict, or do people bother you.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: You’re intervenes by current RAs and campus housing administrators. There is a group interview as well as individual. In the individual interview you’re graded based on set criteria, it’s very important to answer what the question asks even if you have something else to say
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to act without preparing

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Informal meeting with a professor. Questions about my experience and education level. He wasn't looking for anything specific, just wanted to get to know me and double check what I wrote on my resume. He briefed me on expectations for the job. Mostly rock crushing.
Interview Questions: When are you available to work? If I am interested in research/grad school?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first obtained an email, which was a few days after finishing an online application.  I then was offered the internship position, and spoke with someone.  it was not very formal, and it makes sense since it was only for the summer and meant to give an undergrad research experience.
Interview Questions: What are your interests?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Based solely on undergraduate research, GPA and test scores
Interview Questions: No real interview.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through www.hirealonghorn.com, and was notified of interview selection through e-mail. Scheduled a phone interview which lasted for about 30 minutes. Simple questions similar to a behavioral type of interview. "Tell me about yourself", "What are your strengths?", etc are examples of what you should expect.
Interview Questions: What do you know about us?

title: Senior Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: UT has a curious mix of go-getters and "dead weight" when it comes to staff. Seasoned line managers who have hired people before still depend on a business manager who coordinates local HR to identify the best candidates. It has been common in the last 10 years for 100 applicants to apply for admin positions, so expect a phone interview before moving forward with two rounds of interviews in person.
Interview Questions: A manager once asked me who my favorite superhero was. She was trying to get a sense of my cultural fit with the division depending on the attitude with which I answered. UT's central HR department would call this an irrelevant question at best because their main concern seems to be to avoid lawsuits ("minimize risk"), but I think the aim of the question was worthwhile. At that time, she was simply doing the best she could to assess cultural fit in a place where central HR tries to maintain the semblance of cultural agnosticism.

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: one on one meeting with IT Supervisor, basic easy going interview, no trick questions, relaxed environment, the supervisor was extremely kind and never made me feel pressured, was open to me asking questions about the position
Interview Questions: Experience serving others

title: Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was a really simple porocess. you just acll them and send in your resume. and then they give you a call back and then you set up an appointment. and then you go into their office and then just ask you basic behavioral questions and it's a really smooth process. they have this down to the T.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very informal interview. Asked a few non-technical questions to rate my skills dealing with people. At the end of the interview, I was offered a job on the spot. The person interviewing me was my future boss.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite music genre?

title: PhD/Masters Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Send in your resume as well as the rest of the packet during the previous fall.  Received an email a few months later.  Visited in February and interviewed with professors.  It was not much of an interview but instead a way to get to know one another and discuss future goals.  A very good way to get to know a professor and for them to get to know you.
Interview Questions: What makes you different from the other students trying to join my lab?

title: Summer Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Houston, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: This can be the most valuable part of the interview. Why do they want to be here-- is it the challenge of the job, advances in the industry, or something specific about your company? Or is the candidate fixated on salary, benefits, and time off?
