title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the team lead directly. We had a phone conversation before in-person meeting. As my background was fairly matching the group expectations, I had the offer immediately after the in-person meeting
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Your future supervisor almost always interviews you. Interviews are usually in their office and very laid back. Interviews usually end with a tour of the office/lab that you will be working in.
Interview Questions: Very standard questions.

title: Night Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I found the job on the ut hiring site and i heard back from them in less than a week. The people are great and they try to make the interview as possible to get to know you.
Interview Questions: I was asked what I would do in a position that should have been told to us at the training.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was informed of an offer via email before being called for an "interview". They had liked my resume enough to accept me to the program but weren't sure who I would work with.
Interview Questions: Asked about my interests and background in the field.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They checked my resume beforehand to make sure I could actually hold a job. When I came in for the interview, they just described the job to me, asked if I still wanted it, and asked me when could I start.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to do a lot of filling and inventory?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with a graduate student in his/her office and discussed my skills, goals, and research interests. It was a very relaxed interview which flowed more like a conversation than a grilling of my capabilities. I found out within a week whether or not I had gotten the position.
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to achieve during your time working in the research lab?

title: Work-Study Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive sit down to evaluate ones social capability. The entire process was very straight forward. You must be able to have a clear understanding of what that particular office does, in order to help others. There are many other students that are in the running to get limited jobs but if you understand how a bureaucracy works then you will do just fine.
Interview Questions: Do you work well with others?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Presentation and meet with faculty. Normal questions about your science and research interests. Discussions about your future goals and projected career trajectory. Discussed in depth my previous research projects and detailed all of my training and experience with a wide range of scientific methods.
Interview Questions: They asked normal questions about my research.

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: One panel interview.  From start to finish (application to interview), the process took about a month.
Interview Questions: Each interview panelist utilized behavioral interviewing questions.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online and took GRE. Wrote an essay about why I wanted to go to graduate school. As far as I know no American student has ever been rejected.
Interview Questions: What is your GRE score on math

title: Senior Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were several rounds of interviewing. The first with an Administrative Manager who reviewed my skill set with the systems used at the University of Texas. I was then given a long description of the job duties and my supervisor. I was next interviewed by two long-time faculty members who were somewhat ill-prepared, however, asked me several general interview questions. My next interview was with my future Direct Supervisor - I was given a long explanation and story of what happened to the previous person who filled the position.  I was then asked several personal questions and then left somewhat confused.  Final interview was given an offer and made to decide on the spot.
Interview Questions: Review of skills with University related systems - some personal questions

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Three step process. Applications are reviewed by the University HR office, then all eligible candidates are forwarded to the hiring department. Usually applicants undergo a first round of interviews with a group, and are invited back for a final interview with supervisors. The process can sometimes take months.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with (a certain 'group' of students) before?

title: ITS Help Desk Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview to pre-screen candidates. Ask you about yourself and a few technical questions mostly dealing with how you would troubleshoot an issue or how to find an IP address, etc. In person interview is you being interviewed by the hiring manager and one full-time employee. It is more technical and also has you role play a call.
Interview Questions: How you would you troubleshoot an email that is not working

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. They were able to get the best candidate through me. The interview  was sort  and lasted  a few minutes. I am not sure how to make stories.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you studied electrical engineering.

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the interviewer. Typical questions such as work experience. Not many technical questions. After a while, the interview got more personal and less professional.
Interview Questions: Not really any difficult questions. Just simple work experience questions.

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: My adviser recommended me and the Supplemental Instruction manager met with me. Quite informal. After discussing the details of my previous role as a Teaching Assistant, we discussed my teaching evaluation results and how comfortable I felt leading a class by myself.
Interview Questions: What courses have you been the teaching assistant for? How long have you been doing it? How were your teaching evaluations?

title: Senior Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: 3 Interviews - two individual, one with a panel: I initially interviewed with the administrative manager who asked technical questions. I then interviewed with faculty members, who were not very well prepared, but asked me to expound on my previous work experience.  I then met with my future immediate supervisor who asked me almost nothing, but spoke at length and then asked me if I wanted the position.  I was then called back in to be offered the position in person and was requested to immediately make a decision and agree on salary.
Interview Questions: Specific systems skills - *Define, Voucher Processing and behavior questions "Tell me about yourself".

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one with each of the two managers at the lab. Simply asked me about my skills using LabVIEW, my goals, and my interest in the area of research and lasers.
Interview Questions: It was all behavioral.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Mostly within department interviews were just professors asking if we would be interested in TA'ing because we were advanced students who had performed well in the class and had research interests in the area. Out of department interviews were typically only with a single professor whose course you would be covering. They ask about general knowledge of the subject matter and ask about availability.
Interview Questions: General information about the topics that will be covered to ensure that candidates are adequate.

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview, then had a 2 hour interview with team of 5 which included behavioral questions, mock coaching sessions, and a presentation.  The whole process was really lengthy, but for the most part they let me know where we were in the process.  Overall, it was great.
Interview Questions: Random question on a bullet from years ago.

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I don't remember if there was a phone interview first, but there was a Skype interview. It was easy. You talk about yourself and ask questions to the interviewer. I remember going in the office in person and having a follow up interview.
Interview Questions: How would you answer the phone?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email to the laboratories I was interested in, and received a few requests for interviews. After that, I met with Principal Investigators and answered a few of their questions.
Interview Questions: How committed are you to pursuing research as a career?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: One-round phone interview
Interview Questions: Asking very detailed about your course projects, since the PI are essentially university professors

title: URHA Senator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was election based within one of the Resident Halls. It involved merely going to one of the Resident Hall Council meetings and stating that you were interested in the position. The members would then give you further information about the next meeting in which we were to briefly describe why we would like the position, and answer any questions the current residents had.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be the President, and how would you help the Residence Hall?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: You may contact by a professor or seek for a professor that has project matches your interest. An online, mostly for international students, or on-site interview directly with the professor is very likely. My interviews was pretty casual and normal, starting with a brief self-introduction. Then I was asked for some previous research experience. Eventually the professor introduced the projects that he had and told me to wait for his email.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your previous graduate/undergraduate research?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted a couple weeks later via email to schedule the initial phone interview. It was with 2 people and was of a technical nature. The questions were fairly easy and the interview was straight forward. I was contacted the next day to schedule the next interview which is usually in person but we opted to use Skype due to my location. This interview was with 2 people as well and was a mixture of personality and technical questions. It was slightly more difficult but still straight forward. Unfortunately, I didn't get an offer but they did contact me to let me know they chose another candidate a week later. I enjoyed the interviews and wouldn't hesitate to apply for a position in the future.
Interview Questions: How would you setup a NFS share?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly informal, they asked questions about your response to hypothetical situations with kids and about your work style. Asked to create a short lesson plan while the interviewer left the room. Was in the headquarters building, so you got to see many of the people working and walking past. Was helpful to see staff's dress code, rapport, how happy they appeared to be, etc. The ANSC site is made for engaging children in nature so it was awkward walking around the site in heels and a pant suit for me. This place is very informal. Nice pants and a nice shirt with flats would be totally acceptable.
Interview Questions: Asked to create a short lesson plan while interviewer left the room.

title: Writing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Mandatory internship class in the Rhetoric dept at UT. You are accepted by applying and sending in writing samples.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Undergraduate Writing Center?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
When they first called me concerning the position, I wasn't expecting an on-the-spot interview.  They asked me about my work history, why I chose to apply with UT Austin, and if I had any Excel and statistical experience.  They then offered me a face-to-face interview.

The face-to-face interview consisted of a 30-minute one-on-one interview with the dean, plus a 30-minute panel interview with the rest of the department.  

Questions asked:
-Tell us about yourself and why you applied for this position.
-Why did you get a master's degree?
-Tell me about a time you had to handle multiple projects at once.  How did you prioritize?
-What did you like about your former employer?
-What's your ideal work environment?
-What do you like to do for fun?
-What would you bring to the position?
-What have you been doing since your last job?
-What are your favorite TV shows?
-Where do you see yourself in five years?
-What brought you to Texas?
-Why are you looking for jobs in Austin rather than Dallas?
-What other companies have you applied for jobs with?
-Out of your former jobs, what was your favorite and why?
-How would your supervisors describe you?
-How would your colleagues describe you?
-Would you be able to work effectively in a team environment?

I then had a Skype interview with the few people that weren't at the office the day I interviewed.  It lasted 20 minutes.

After the Skype interview, I know they started to do a reference check, but I have not heard anything yet.  It's only been one day, though.
Interview Questions: There weren't any unexpected or unusually challenging questions.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: Have a GPA of at least 3.00 and have made an A in the class you wanted to teach. They asked you about your experience teaching, background information and skills. They also ask about the availability  you have during the week and explain you the process and rules you need to follow
Interview Questions: How do you practice safety in you personal life

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin
Interview Descriptions: After you apply online they will contact you via e-mail to invite you for an interview. There are three different types of interviews. The first is a one-on-one interview with a hall supervisor and two RAs. The second one is a case study interview with other candidates. The third one is a group activity.
Interview Questions: Tell me of a time when you had to deal with something unexpected and how did you handle it.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Basic interview. Come ready with examples how you tackled challanges. 

Had to do a phone screening interview, very simple and basic questions. Then did a face to face interviews with the hiring manager and one with another manager. Was offered the job a week after the interview with the other manager.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for this position based off your previous experience?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: easy interview with pretty friendly people. very easy and basic questions. no tricky questions. anyone who is really ready to work hard and to get some desirable results this can be a good place.
Interview Questions: why do want to join this employee

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I went and talked to a professor and asked if I could work for her and she said yes. I asked what skills I needed and she told me and I learned those skills. It was very easy and laid back, if you are a student in UT in the sciences you should absolutely do research, it is really good for your career.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work there, what was I interested in doing.

title: Reading Room Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Position became available and they were looking to hire immediately. I sent in an email with my resume and a cover letter. The person hiring called me that same day. I was out of town so interviewed over the phone. Basic questions about personality and time management. Basically just wanted to see how I could communicate with her in a timely manner and whether or not I would be able to get daily job functions done efficiently.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with PI. After the phone interview I was flown to Austin and spent a day and a half at the lab. I met with grad students in the group, attended a group lunch, and gave a presentation at the group meeting.
Interview Questions: What was a challenge that you faced in graduate school and how did you overcome it?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Formal application for PhD with all the necessary documents including resume, statement of purpose, GRE scores, TOEFL score (if you are an international student)
Interview Questions: You have to justify why you and UT are best fit for each other in statement of purpose

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application through their website.  Contacted by HR a few weeks later to set up an interview.  Met with director and person who's job I was taking over.  2 weeks later I was contacted for a second interview with additional people the job was working with.  I was offered the position a week or so later.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where there was ambiguity. How did you solve the problem?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: First, I received a phone call and had a phone screen. The phone screen was followed by a face to face interview with the hiring manager and two of his direct reports. One individual wound up becoming my direct report. The final interview was conduced by the department head.
Interview Questions: Was I familiar with Agile and SDLC development methodologies?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed questions about your past work experience. I had to explain exact work procedures, how I structured my work and which skills I have earned are gonna be useful for the job. I was hoping it would not last long, but it did. It was not that painful as one might think. Just a little annoying.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Brief 30 minute meeting on campus with the man who would become my supervisor and an HR Representative from the department, short skills test and finally a tour of the school
Interview Questions: Tell us about your interpersonal skills?

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very simple. After applying online you will receive an email either letting you know you that they are not going to move forward or they will schedule an interview with you if you match the profile. It is important that you highlight that you are responsible, organized, and can multi-task. The job is very simple and the most important thing is that you ALWAYS are on time.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Student Associate Professional At ISSS Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Back when I was hired as a student worker at the International Office during the summer, I didn't have a formal interview. I was hired for the summer to help out with the Briefing and checking process, and therefore I didn't know I would be hired permanently as a part-time staff. Luckily, they were looking for some people to work during the school year and I told them I was available.
Interview Questions: I didn't have a formal interview. However, they asked whether I had some experience in customer service.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Take the GRE and submit your app. Pretty easy. Have good grades from undergrad and demonstrate an interest in doing graduate level research. Also helps to talk to professor beforehand.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go to grad school

title: Research Engineering/Scientist Associate IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was invited for an on-site informal interview. I gave an open presentation, talked to some professors and students there, had lunch and dinner with them. I was told about my future job expectations and salary range.
Interview Questions: How is your current research?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a short in-person conversation with the lead researcher of the group. It was done in the lead researcher's office in a very relaxed setting. It felt more like a conversation than a formal interview.
Interview Questions: Do you think this lab a right for you? What do you see yourself doing after graduation? Do you prefer science or engineering?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: This is an online interview through Skype. It takes about 40 mins. And I got the offer 10 days after the interview. The interview is not that hard, including a couple of technical questions.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you apply for this program?

title: Departmental Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via the UT job search function, but was already working in the department in a different role. Submitted resume only. Interview was with a 5 person interview board of people within and outside the department. Interview consisted of competency based questions. Interviewed on Friday and selected on Monday.
Interview Questions: Once you were finished with your work, or if you had nothing to do, what would you do with your time?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: They would ask you behavior questions like "Why are you interested in research?" They also ask you your relevant coursework. If you haven't take the course relevant to the research, they will teach you during the weekly checkpoints. You do have to know the basic lab safety and procedures. The teacher assistant will interview you, not the professor. The interview is less than 30 minutes and there is no contract. They would like to meet the team as well.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I got this job by a stroke of luck, really. I don't know if I could repeat the process and get the job again, if I were in the same situation today. Our departmental advisor sent out an email requesting a student for a vague job, I responded, the graduate student contacted me, and we talked for about 10 minutes and he hired me.
Interview Questions: My specific availability and pushed me to commit to a certain number of hours, then and there.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: skype, for about 30min. I asked the future plan for my research and what the expectation was. Then, I ask what the research are in the lab. During the whole interview, we exchanged the ideas for research. In addition, the requirement for graduation, and how long it will be, as well as the internship in summer
Interview Questions: my previous research

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted within two days of applying via email. We scheduled an interview within two weeks for the position.  After the interview a decision was rendered after 3 weeks. I was interviewed by the director of the program in his office. Very friendly encounter that was more of a running dialogue than hard pressed questions. The work culture was very relaxed.
Interview Questions: Do you have any contacts within the entertainment industry at networks, studios, guilds and unions?

title: Garage Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I found the job posted online on the campus website. I applied and heard back by phone within a week or two. I was brought in to an interview with a supervisor. Talked about resume and a couple basic questions, but nothing difficult. They basically just wanted to know if I was responsible. I got the job a few days later. It's the best part time job out there for a student, in my opinion. A lot of time to study and do other things at work when the garages are quiet.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with a panel, which was helpful in getting different feedback about the position and organization.
Interview Questions: Describe your backgroud in marketing?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a phone interview, which was followed by a face to face with the grant manager. The final step was the submission of a writing sample.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straighforward academic interview. I applied, they accepted. I didn't visit the campus beforehand, but took the offer immediately. There was no formal interview process. I was hired as an assistant instructor immediately, but I had experience teaching before.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: applied online and then received an email confirming that i had been hired for this position, and could start when i returned from out of town. When i did return a few days later, i was informed that the hiring manager had "forgotten" that he had given the job to me. By then, the position was filled and my job given away
Interview Questions: there werent any difficult questions

title: Human Resources III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Most jobs at UT go through the same process - online application (complete every step, even the typing test and spelling test if required) or you will be automatically disqualified. There is a phone screen, followed by the hiring committee panel interview and then a final interview with the team you would actually be working with.  Preference is given to University work experience. There is usually a Background Check required and for many positions a 3 year driving record.
Interview Questions: Questions are the usual thing - What is your biggest challenge in your previous job. Why do you want to work here. What is your biggest weakness. etc.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Networked with my then-future boss through graduate school. Performance in the classroom as part of a team was my real interview, the formal interview was more of a formality.  While this position was technically at UT-Austin, the funding was direct federal government grant, not the typical State of Texas (legislature, budget) funding.  That means there was more flexibility in how the position was configured, and that it was contingent on our team securing follow-on funding.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute to UT-Austin research in support of US Army contracts?

title: Recruitment Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Just a week or two after applying, I received an e-mail asking if I could discuss my strengths and experience with the hiring department.  I had a phone screen with a member of the team for which I was applying, and it went very well.  It was entirely behavioral and went by quickly.  The next day, I was invited to come to campus the following week to interview with the team.  Four people interviewed me in a panel, and it was all behavioral as well.  It went smoothly, and I was asked at the end of the week if I would like the position.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the department, and what could you tell one of our clients about the business process?

title: UTemp Position Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Simple placement into a department needing temporary assistance. Once I worked with them for  a while they decided to hire full time. I had minimal interviewing, but I suspect it's not that way for every department.
Interview Questions: Do you see yourself growing your career here.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I just come to talk with the graduate coordinator. She asked me to do the ITA test for an international student. I took the test and it was fine. THen I got the position
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submit your application, wait to hear back and then visit the department for 2 days. Meeting with faculty and graduate students, presentations from faculty, poster sessions etc. Overall just had to be on best behavior, although 1 on 1 meetings with faculty were important in my case as I met my future boss that day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want a PhD?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: fair they put me at ease. i really am very happy. i will definitely recommed the opportunities they provide to everyine. very very very happy. I hope that everyone experiences the same.
Interview Questions: weaknesses / strengths

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I simply submitted my resume through GURU and received an email from the graduate student. He asked for a simple meet and greet. I was not expecting a full interview. He went through each and every line of my resume and asked me to explain each role and how I can apply those skills to the new position. Make sure the experiences you have listed on your resume relate somehow to the position you want.
Interview Questions: 'Please tell me how *insert past position* will help you succeed as a researcher in our lab.'

title: Student Development Specialist I Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed with office manager and supervisor (graduate coordinator). Interview was mostly behaviorial questions. Would you answer the phone if an important guest was standing in front of you? What would you do with problem faculty/students? What accomplishment are you most proud of? 
Everyone seemed laid back and nice. 
Heard back from them the next day that I did not receive the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do if an important guest was standing in front of you and the phone was ringing?

title: Assistant Director, Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Austin (Austin, TX) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online w samples, resume, cover letter. Received call quickly to set up phone interview. That went well, so they brought me to Austin for 1/1 and group interviews. Called within a few days to offer the job.
Interview Questions: Describe your vision for the editorial product we are potentially hiring you to create. (not unexpected, but difficult)

title: Instructional Designer Interview

Initial interview with entire team (5 people) then a follow up interview with the supervisor.

Will vary widely from department to department,

Typical interview questions.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: Resident Assistant Interview
